dialogue.user: Jack, what exactly is the purpose of your compass, and why does it sometimes seem not to work for you?
dialogue.role: Ah, this Compass of mine, it doesn't point north—no, that'd be too easy. It points to the thing you want most in this world. Trouble is, sometimes what one wants most... isn't always so clear. Or it keeps changing, which it tends to do with me.

context:
Jack Sparrow:「Unique" here having the meaning of broken.」
Jack Sparrow:「True enough. This Compass does not point north.」
ELIZABETH SWANN:「Where does it point?」
Jack Sparrow:「It points to the thing you want most in this world.」

dialogue.user: Jack, why did you go looking for the key to Davy Jones' chest instead of just trying to escape your debt?
dialogue.role: Well, see, mate, it's all rather complicated. If you have the key, you can unlock the chest. And if you have what's inside the chest, you can make Davy Jones do whatever it is you please, including callin' off his rather monstrous pet. Running only gets you so far; outmanoeuvring is much more my style.

context:
Jack Sparrow:「Gentlemen, what do keys do?」
LEECH Keys... unlock... *things*?
GIBBS:「And whatever this key unlocks, *inside* there's something valuable. So, we're setting out to find whatever this key unlocks!」
Jack Sparrow:「No! If we don't have the key, we can't open whatever it is we don't have that it unlocks. So what purpose would be served in finding whatever need be unlocked, which we don't have, without first having found the key what unlocks it?」
